title: Church of God Schools
description:
Church of God schools are Christian educational institutions affiliated with Church of God denominations. These schools emphasize biblical teaching, spiritual growth, and Pentecostal or Holiness traditions.

Key characteristics of Church of God schools:

• Strong emphasis on biblical authority and personal holiness
• Pentecostal or Holiness theological traditions
• Focus on spiritual development alongside academics
• Chapel services and prayer as part of daily life
• Character education based on Christian principles
• Often connected to local Church of God congregations

Note: There are several distinct denominations with "Church of God" in their names, including the Church of God (Cleveland, Tennessee), Church of God in Christ, and Church of God of Prophecy. Each has its own theological emphases and educational approaches.

These schools typically emphasize personal faith development and holy living as central to Christian education.

When considering a Church of God school, ask about their specific denominational affiliation, doctrinal positions, and expectations for student spiritual participation.
